gurmukhi: qiRX kI CwXw lY qbY biRMdw rcI bnwie ]
transliteration: Triya Kichhaadaa Lai Tabai Brindaa Rachibanaae||
translation: Then Vishnu created Varinda from the shadow of his wife.

gurmukhi: DUmRkys dwnv sdn jnm Drq BeI jwie ]10]
transliteration: Dhoomrakes Daanav Sadan Janam Dharat Bhaijaae||10||
translation: She took birth on the earth in the house of the demon Dhumarkesh.10.

gurmukhi: jYsk rhq kml jl BIqr ]puin niRp bsI jlMDr ky Gr ]
transliteration: Jaisak Rahat Kamal Jai Bheetar|| Poun(i) Nrip Basijalandhar Ke Ghar||
translation: Just as the lotus-leaf in water remains unaffected by the drops of water, in the same manner, Varinda lived in the house of Jalandhar as his wife.

gurmukhi: iqh inimq jlMDr Avqwrw ]Dr hY rUp AnUp murwrw ]11]
transliteration: Tih Nimit Jalandhar Avtaaraa|| Dhar Hai Roop Anoop Muraaraa||11||
translation: And for her Vishnu manifested himself as Jalandhar and in this way, Vishnu assumed a unique form.11.

gurmukhi: kQw AYs ieh ids mo BeI ]Ab cl bwq rudR pr geI ]
transliteration: Kathaa Ais Eh Dis Mo Bhaee|| Ab Chal Baat Rudra Par Gade||
translation: In this way, the story heath taken a new turn and now it hath halted on Rudra.

gurmukhi: mwNgI nwr n dInI ru`dRw ]qwN qy kop Asur pq Cu`dRw ]12]
transliteration: Maaninaar Deeniruddraa|| Taan Te Kop Asur Pat Chhuddraa||12||
translation: The demon Jalandhar asked for his wife from Ruda and Rudra did not oblige him, therefore the king of demons flew into rage instantly.12.

gurmukhi: b`jy Fol nPIir ngwry ]duhU idsw fmrU fmkwry ]
transliteration: Bajje Dhol Napheer(i0 Nagdare|| Dahoo Disaa Damroo Damkdare||
translation: The trumpets and drums resounded on all the four sides and the knocking sound of tabors was heard from all the four directions.

gurmukhi: mwcq BXo loh ibkrwrw ]Jmkq K`g Ad`g Apwrw ]13]
transliteration: Maachat Bhayo Loh Bikaaraa|| Jhamkat Khagg Adagg Apaaraa||13||
translation: The steel collided with the steel dreadfully and the daggers glittered with infinite beauty.13.

gurmukhi: igr igr prq suBt rx mwhIN ]Duk Duk auTq mswx qhwhIN ]
transliteration: Gir Gir Parat Soubhat Ran Maaheen|| Dhouk Outhat Masaan||
translation: The warriors began to fall in the battlefield and the ghosts and fiends began to run on all the four sides.

gurmukhi: gjI rQI bwjI pYdl rx ]jUJ igry rx kI iCq Angx ]14]
transliteration: Gadirathibaajipaidal Ran|| Joojh Gire Ran Kichhit Anad||14||
translation: The innumerable riders of elephants, chariots and horses began to fall as martyrs in the battlefield.14.

gurmukhi: ibcry rxbIr su DIr kRuDM ]m`icXo iqh dwrux BUm juDM ]
transliteration: Bichre Ranbeer Su Dheer Krudhan|| Machchiyo Tih Daaroun Bhoom Judhan||
translation: The warriors moved in the battlefield in great anger and a dreadful war began.
